full_text:
And on the 8th week, AJ Cole had a bye and rested on his laurels

Side note, what's happening in Carolina?!?

#nflverse #ForTheBrand https://t.co/uPpmQZrjjQ

bettors seduced by the allure of patrick mahomes have had their hearts broken üíî & bankrolls bankrupted üìâover the last two seasons, bleeding bettors of cash 13 of the last 16 games (not including postseason, which is even worse). #nflverse https://t.co/1scHi4ILcl

while chiefs bettors have gotten ripped to shreds ‚ò†Ô∏è, cowboys bettors are sitting pretty ‚ò∫Ô∏è: 6-1 SU and 7-0 ATS, earning an est. $16 million season-to-date (per @pregame data, which may be a bit spurious, but is surely at least directionally accurate) #nflverse https://t.co/WiR9qxt5H2

mike white first game vs. newton first game.
from #nflverse #TakeFlight https://t.co/zlSLEi4JRR

A lot of people are talking about the decline of the Chiefs offense in the last couple of weeks. I checked the evolution of each team's offensive epa using rolling averages and the Chiefs' struggles can be clearly seen. 
Data: #nflverse https://t.co/3XY4i53jAI

Week 7 Puntalytics Update:
Not much change at the top as #RaiderNation AJ Cole widens his gap on the field

Turns out that NFL level punters > replacement level punters though

#nflverse https://t.co/PPa0SC0Ix7

And on the 8th week, AJ Cole had a bye and rested on his laurels

Side note, what's happening in Carolina?!?

#nflverse #ForTheBrand https://t.co/uPpmQZrjjQ

tutorial #3 on modeling in R is out! this one covers making a logistic regression model to measure field goal kickers (seen below) and a linear regression model to see which quarterbacks are aggressive #nflverse

youtube link: https://t.co/Kzls4F9d9d https://t.co/QPO9TPPzTa

Doing this per player is fun
#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/8BM17tSR48

A lot of people are talking about the decline of the Chiefs offense in the last couple of weeks. I checked the evolution of each team's offensive epa using rolling averages and the Chiefs' struggles can be clearly seen. 
Data: #nflverse https://t.co/3XY4i53jAI

It is one thing to build a lead in the NFL, it is another to extend leads. Pre MNF, and using success rate(SR), we can get a sense of which teams have been best extending leads so far. Here is each team's SR & number of plays run with comfortable leads #nflverse https://t.co/DEo8tkR8Vt

the outperformance of heavy NFL favorites season-to-date is downright obnoxious üòí

backtesting a zero-CLV strategy of blindly betting -300 and ^ sides on spread + ML ('to win' $100/bet) from weeks 1-7 since '06 has never been more profitable. a 2-sigma event.

#rstats #nflverse https://t.co/ARVc4HbgWP https://t.co/gK8zYwCAI2

if you blindly bet all -300 and ^ favorites 'to win' $100 on both spread + ML (+ zero-CLV) you'd be up over $3,000 on the season üëÅÔ∏èüëÑüëÅÔ∏è

no other yr since '06 (limit of dataset) comes even close.  next best was '07 when the "strategy" yielded $1,200 (-$2,800 in '17). #nflverse https://t.co/tdnCxv3Xgg

we demonstrated the unprecedented success of betting NFL favorites this yr: but how long can it last?

there were 6 other instances since '06 where blindly betting heavy favorites yielded + pnl thru 7 weeks: decisive reversion 66% of the time over the next 10 weeks 

#nflverse https://t.co/MIo91H1QYq https://t.co/7YTc4XxqSW

The "Ja'Marr Chase down there somewhere" effect: Cincinnati is 8th in points scored this year, but dead last (!) in Red Zone plays. Takeaways:
üìàJoe Mixon is probably due for some positive touchdown regression`
ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èUnlikely that Chase can keep scoring 50 yarders each week
#nflverse https://t.co/olekVHf8lN

Finally, finally finished up this graph. 

Here are the EPA distributions for our 2021 rookie QB's on dropbacks. 

Big thanks to @CedScherer  @BrunoHMioto @mrcaseb  who walked me through my struggles. It really is amazing the kind of help people provide on here! 

#nflverse https://t.co/amfhF6JjPR

Top 10 #NFL leaders in Mean Yards After Catch, Week 8. Ja'Marr Chase already becoming one of the most electric playmakers in the NFL. #WeeklyMeanYACReport 
#nflverse https://t.co/r8noCz3mDY

@NFLUK @NFL As a UK fan I think you should release a limited edition set of team caps with the Union Jack on them! 
#NFL #nflverse #manycountriesonegame

@reinhurdler This is really tricky though. It's impossible using #nflverse level data to understand whether - if not for the penalty - the penalty-free outcome is what would have happened (e.g. an offensive hold may have prevented a sack).

Moving into week 8, my #nfl model continues to calibrate (and frankly, come to its senses after last week!). After the surprise beatdown of the @Ravens, the @Bengals climb the projection table into a pole position in the AFC - I'm not sure I buy it! #nflverse https://t.co/2zq0HRlbTr https://t.co/qLKpZil7kT

The model had its best week in @FiveThirtyEight & @LeeSharpeNFL prediction game last week, calling the @Titans dominance of the @Chiefs.  This week's bold predictions? @ChicagoBears over @49ers and a toss up in @Buccaneers #nflverse https://t.co/MSRYuAVb0T

Here are the model's estimates of the "true" underlying team strength, with uncertainty bands.  Clear tiers are emerging in both conferences - what stands out to you? #nflverse https://t.co/ZxzwLDPz6F

Updated turnover risk/damage chart

Bottom left is calculated risk-takers

Top left is careful but unlucky 

Bottom right is reckless but lucky

Top right is the irresponsible corner

#nflverse https://t.co/udWXT3nrHg

how Stafford 300 TD came
from #nflverse #OnePride https://t.co/rNP8l4nZiD

Epa/play with or without INT and FUM
from #nflverse https://t.co/wUQ5gnFW5g

mike white first game vs. newton first game.
from #nflverse #TakeFlight https://t.co/zlSLEi4JRR

Cumulative point differential for each team at the end of each quarter. Top first half point differentials in 2021:

1) TB (+68)
2) BUF (+67)
3) ARI (+55)
4) CAR (+40)
5) CLE (+31)

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/GI17nljf9u

I saw a lot of talk about how boring this week's slate of games were, so I looked into it. The data generally supports that notion.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/wc0wn4KOXW

How much does each QB's EPA+CPOE Index change if we assume all of their dropped passes in 2021 were caught?

Stafford and Murray are still 1-2, but Mahomes and Brady get a nice bump. Aaron Rodgers would fall from 3rd to 9th.

Data: #nflverse / Sportradar https://t.co/EmjImsTwTk

Mac Jones and Trevor Lawrence will be the new Herbert/Burrow duo.

#nflverse https://t.co/sJnEfXhTqw

Ja'Marr Chase and his new record. 
Whaaatttt?!?!? üò≥

@Real10jayy__
#nflverse https://t.co/zgTmI4PN1b

Through the first 8 week, the xp conversion percentage is the lower since 2015 new rule and it could be worst at the end of regular season.

Since 2015, only the Chargers has twice under 80% perc O.o

#nflverse 
#nfldaznitaly https://t.co/tTZUik7olx

Updated Field Goals over Expected results through Week 7:
#nflverse https://t.co/3zwIP4yas4

Patrick Mahomes ALMOST (by 0.01 EPA/play) had their worst game ever this last Sunday. The worst? SB LV.
#nflverse #RStats #ggplot2 https://t.co/EgEIy1uw1K

Matthew Stafford keeps having greater games with Rams than he had his entire career with Lions.
His last game against Texans was better than 97% of all his games.

Data: #nflverse 
#RStats #ggplot2 https://t.co/a3co23F4d8

Week 7 Puntalytics Update:
Not much change at the top as #RaiderNation AJ Cole widens his gap on the field

Turns out that NFL level punters > replacement level punters though
